text: oh hi everyone Anthony Fantino here
the Internet's busiest music nerd and
it's time for a review Animal Collective
centipede hurts this is the latest LP
from Sonic experimentalists Animal
Collective their ninth full-length album
I believe maybe not their ninth LP
technically as Animal Collective but
their ninth LP together as a group of
musicians and if you've been paying
relatively close attention to
underground independent music for the
past eight to five years you have
probably heard of Animal Collective and
know a bit about the reputation the
2000s brought a league of new sounds
expressions and ideas to the world of
psychedelic rock and pop just neo
psychedelia and as far as this new breed
of psychedelic artists go very few of
them were as bold and as strange and as
polarizing as Animal Collective with one
album after another the band would
deliver indescribable sound effects and
an extreme use of the sound effects and
studio trickery that we're already
familiar with shouted vocals harmonized
vocals weird angular melodies
inspiration coming from numerous styles
of music coming from around the world
it's kind of difficult to do an
overarching you know kind of picture a
description of the band style because
there is a noticeable shift in in sound
on every animal collective release
they've always brought some kind of
evolution whether it's to the wild and
noisy and abrasive here comes the Indian
or the very kind of harmonious and
stripped down and pretty song tongs or
the very fun inspiring and colorful
strawberry jam now their last full
length album Merriweather Post Pavilion
was their biggest success yet and an
album that was by far their poppy esteem
really took their usual abrasiveness and
threw it out of the window one of the
members panda bear who would usually you
know split songwriting duties with
another member of the band AV tare
really kind of took the reins on that
record as far as singing and songwriting
and as far as production and
presentation goes Merriweather Post
Pavilion was definitely their biggest
and in glossiest album ever it was still
an animal collective album but very very
groomed as groomed as you were gonna get
them while still maintaining what makes
them fundamentally them plus the album
just had some really fantastic singles
brother sport summertime clothes and of
course what pretty much dominated all of
2009 and just blog ability and remix
ability my girls this album just brought
an immense amount of hype toward them
and just internet harvested independent
music in general this LP a lot of ways
just marks a huge turning point not only
for Animal Collective but for
psychedelic music as well how we as
listeners share and talked about music
and in the blogosphere that writes about
this music every day earlier this year
the band dropped a new single which I
gave a very positive review to and there
was the announcement that Deacon a
member of the band who kind of took a
temporary leave during the time the band
was making Merriweather Post Pavilion
was now back plus you had the track
today supernatural which dropped before
the release of this album kind of
promoting toward the release of this
album gave it a review very positive
review love the song still love this
song and to me that track forecasted a
much rahrr noisier and just more
strawberry jam esque
kind of album which I was excited for
and got to an extent but I can't help
but feel a bit disappointed by the end
product and the main reason is that for
sure just easily no question this is the
first time I am picking up a new animal
collective album and the band has not
introduced me to anything new wildly
different or done anything surprising
with their progression or evolution and
now that that gripe is out of the way my
second biggest gripe on this album the
production is
pretty underwhelming Merriweather Post
Pavilion was certainly like I said
Animal Collective spa piaced release but
going more experimental mean kind of
scaling back the big gargantuan
presentation and and the lushness of
their sound and making things just more
muddy more messy the vocal harmonies the
animal collective puts out no longer are
soaring and then really kind of like awe
inspiring they're really kind of
grounded in in loads of effects and in a
very claustrophobic mix the
claustrophobic mix that really has every
song kind of feeling too alike for
comfort and really kind of kills a few
of the very tender moments on this LP I
felt like one of my favorite tracks on
here Newtown burnout could have been
more stripped-down near the end you know
sans all the effects and wacky noises it
just would have been a good tune I
really can't help but feel like the
sound effects on that track aren't
helping or enhancing the music in the
same way they would be on fields or
strawberry jam centipede Hertz's is
definitely really chaotic and hectic but
it's kind of to the point where it's
impeding on the enjoy ability of some of
these tracks like the track mercury man
for example which i think is the kinds
of the kind of the kinds of the kind of
the kinds of the best melody on this
entire album and a nice kind of emphasis
on the upbeat toward the beginning of
the track kind of reminds me of like a
psychedelic weird glitchy reggae tune or
something like that but the thing is
especially toward the end of the track
where things get really kind of melodic
you really kind of get more sounds in
there the vocals which are really kind
of just bringing all the emotion to the
tune are just shoved down underneath
everything and in a really I guess
unflattering way or the song rosio which
has a really great melody as well you
have a bass a guitar of beat on their
vocals but the thing is the the tune is
good there's nothing really all that
weird or psychedelic about the sounds of
those instruments are making everything
surrounding the track is what's kind of
what's making a weird sound and to me it
just kind of feels like well what's the
point you could easily subtract all of
these effects and
the same exact tune I'm not seeing these
sounds or effects adding to the song
it's just kind of like looking at
yourself in a foggy mirror and just like
trying to wipe it and wipe it and wipe
it and it just does not come clear the
track monkey riches for example is
another track that to me feels too
chaotic to the point where the verse and
the chorus just don't really have that
much contrast when you hear that shift
in the song there's not really a
different feeling or anything like that
the other issue that I have with this LP
be the the smallest one that I have is
the animal collective does not bring the
usual interesting song structures or
interesting melodies to some of these
songs the track wide-eyed which i think
is a deacon contribution to the album is
a really monotonous track the sound of
the guitars on that thing really call
back to the older world of psychedelic
rock which I didn't really care for all
too much
I know Animal Collective does have a
huge Brian Wilson influence but this
just felt kind of out of place to me
plus the beat in just the phrasing of
the guitar just everything about the
track is just kind of monotonous the
groove just kind of gets old and some
reason deacons voice just has kind of a
Jeff Mangum quality to it the song to me
kind of feels like a glitched out
Neutral Milk Hotel track the song
pulleys is well toward the end of the
album doesn't really have much of an
impressive progression to it either
overall I think this is a record that
would have been fun to make but you know
maybe not as fun to me to listen to I
feel like I just got a good chunk of
songs on this album kind of sounding
more complicated than they really are
just because so many effects are thrown
on top of them I don't feel like Animal
Collective has toned their sound down at
all in a lot of ways they're they're
more potent than ever but I can't help
but feel like so many of these tracks
for me personally would have had more
impact if they actually felt kind of
organized some better production would
have helped that and I think it would
have resulted in an album with with more
variety typically I like dense albums
but I just kind of found this LP to be a
bit redundant and I find myself liking a
lot of ideas on this album too oh this
parts really lush
that's a cool vocal that's a great
melody
that's an interesting sound but rarely
did all of these characteristics or or
just all of the stars align on these
tracks and just make me think yes this

kind of felt like a lot of songs on here
we're just underwhelming not horrible
